intro: Grammitis fabispora, commonly known as the slender-leaf moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Grammitis fabispora plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
